intro: Microsemma ciliaris, commonly known as the silverleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in a daisy-like pattern. The plant has silvery, fuzzy foliage that gives it its common name and helps reduce water loss in arid environments. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Microsemma ciliaris is cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in gardens with full sun.
